items.line_en: Never in a million years did I think I would become a successful business owner?

coach.say: Never in a million years did I think I would become a successful business owner?
coach.hint: Chunk it: Never in a million years did I think I would become a successful business owner?

items.line_en: I used to be the black sheep of my family.

coach.say: I used to be the black sheep of my family.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I used to be the black sheep of my family.

items.line_en: Driving everyone nuts with my behavior.

coach.say: Driving everyone nuts with my behavior.
coach.hint: Chunk it: Driving everyone nuts with my behavior.

items.line_en: As a teenager, I would drive my parents' car very fast.

coach.say: As a teenager, I would drive my parents' car very fast.
coach.hint: Chunk it: As a teenager, / I would drive my parents' car very fast.

items.line_en: I hung out with some kids who liked to do bad things in the neighborhood.

coach.say: I hung out with some kids who liked to do bad things in the neighborhood.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I hung out with some kids who liked to do bad things in the neighborhood.

items.line_en: My parents didn't know all the bad things I was doing.

coach.say: My parents didn't know all the bad things I was doing.
coach.hint: Chunk it: My parents didn't know all the bad things I was doing.

items.line_en: I would pull the wool over my parents' eyes, saying I was staying after school.

coach.say: I would pull the wool over my parents' eyes, saying I was staying after school.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I would pull the wool over my parents' eyes, / saying I was staying after school.

items.line_en: When I was really meeting up with my friends.

coach.say: When I was really meeting up with my friends.
coach.hint: Chunk it: When I was really meeting up with my friends.

items.line_en: I went behind my parents' backs quite often.

coach.say: I went behind my parents' backs quite often.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I went behind my parents' backs quite often.

items.line_en: But one day I was caught red handed.

coach.say: But one day I was caught red handed.
coach.hint: Chunk it: But one day I was caught red handed.

items.line_en: I was at my friend Tony's house while his parents were out of town.

coach.say: I was at my friend Tony's house while his parents were out of town.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I was at my friend Tony's house while / his parents were out of town.

items.line_en: We were drinking alcohol and listening to loud music.

coach.say: We were drinking alcohol and listening to loud music.
coach.hint: Chunk it: We were drinking alcohol and / listening to loud music.

items.line_en: I got an argument with him and in the heat of the moment.

coach.say: I got an argument with him and in the heat of the moment.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I got an argument with him and / in the heat of the moment.

items.line_en: I shoved him and he fell down the stairs.

coach.say: I shoved him and he fell down the stairs.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I shoved him and / he fell down the stairs.

items.line_en: Normally I wouldn't hurt a fly.

coach.say: Normally I wouldn't hurt a fly.
coach.hint: Chunk it: Normally I wouldn't hurt a fly.

items.line_en: But I had drunk too much and I was out of control.

coach.say: But I had drunk too much and I was out of control.
coach.hint: Chunk it: But I had drunk too much and / I was out of control.

items.line_en: I felt that about what I had done. Tony was badly injured.

coach.say: I felt that about what I had done. Tony was badly injured.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I felt that about what I had done. / Tony was badly injured.

items.line_en: I had to call my parents to take us to the hospital.

coach.say: I had to call my parents to take us to the hospital.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I had to call my parents to take us to the hospital.

items.line_en: I made a fool of myself when my parents came to the door and I still had a drink in my hand.

coach.say: I made a fool of myself when my parents came to the door and I still had a drink in my hand.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I made a fool of myself when my parents came to the door and / I still had a drink in my hand.

items.line_en: My mother was as pale as a ghost when she saw me.

coach.say: My mother was as pale as a ghost when she saw me.
coach.hint: Chunk it: My mother was as pale as a ghost when / she saw me.

items.line_en: My parents took Tony to the hospital but they told me that I was out of line.

coach.say: My parents took Tony to the hospital but they told me that I was out of line.
coach.hint: Chunk it: My parents took Tony to the hospital but / they told me that I was out of line.

items.line_en: I realized that all that glitter is not gold and I had been acting foolishly.

coach.say: I realized that all that glitter is not gold and I had been acting foolishly.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I realized that all that glitter is not gold and / I had been acting foolishly.

items.line_en: I told my parents I was sorry but action speak louder than words.

coach.say: I told my parents I was sorry but action speak louder than words.
coach.hint: Chunk it: I told my parents I was sorry but / action speak louder than words.

items.line_en: They didn't trust me after that day.

coach.say: They didn't trust me after that day.
coach.hint: Chunk it: They didn't trust me after that day.

items.line_en: I wasn't allowed to use the car or go to my friend's houses for a long time.

coach.hint: Chunk it: I wasn't allowed to use the car or / go to my friend's houses for a long time.

items.line_en: Over my dead body my dad would say to me when I wanted to take the car.

coach.hint: Chunk it: Over my dead body my dad would say to me when / I wanted to take the car.

items.line_en: So I soon became a couch potato.

coach.say: So I soon became a couch potato.
coach.hint: Chunk it: So I soon became a couch potato.

items.line_en: I wasn't interested in the school and I refused to do my schoolwork.

coach.hint: Chunk it: I wasn't interested in the school and / I refused to do my schoolwork.

items.line_en: My grades were always bad because I was lazy.

coach.hint: Chunk it: My grades were always bad because / I was lazy.

items.line_en: Once in a blue moon I would do my homework but most of the time I thought there was no point.

coach.hint: Chunk it: Once in a blue moon I would do my homework but / most of the time I thought there was no point.

coach.hint: Chunk it: Instead I wanted to be in a rock band.

coach.hint: Chunk it: I learned to play the guitar by a year and / I thought I was really good.

coach.hint: Chunk it: I was using music to distract me from my failures.

coach.hint: Chunk it: That same school year I had a teacher, / Mr. / Andrews, / who challenged me.

items.line_en: His style of teaching caught my eye from the very beginning.

coach.hint: Chunk it: His style of teaching caught my eye from the very beginning.

items.line_en: The classroom was as quiet as a mouse.

coach.say: The classroom was as quiet as a mouse.
coach.hint: Chunk it: The classroom was as quiet as a mouse.

items.line_en: The sky is the limit. You just have to believe in yourself.
